io.netty.handler.codec.dns

Class DnsHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.handler.codec.dns.DnsHeader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DnsQueryHeader, DnsResponseHeader

    public class DnsHeader
extends Object
    The header super-class which includes information shared by DNS query and response packet headers such as the ID, opcode, and type. The only flag shared by both classes is the flag for desiring recursion.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      • OPCODE_IQUERY

        @Deprecated
public static final int OPCODE_IQUERY
        Deprecated. 
        Message is for an inverse query. Note: inverse queries have been obsoleted since RFC 3425, and are not necessarily supported.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public DnsHeader setRecursionDesired(boolean recursionDesired)
        Sets whether a name server is directed to pursue a query recursively or not.
        Parameters:
        recursionDesired - if set to true, pursues query recursively

      • z

        public int z()
        Returns the 3 bit reserved field 'Z'.

      • setZ

        public DnsHeader setZ(int z)
        Sets the field Z. This field is reserved and should remain as 0 if the DNS server does not make usage of this field.
        Parameters:
        z - the value for the reserved field Z
